channel.title: üè¢ Google DeepMind on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Google DeepMind on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Amortized Planning with Large-Scale Transformers: A Case Study on Chess
item.description: Large-scale transformers achieve grandmaster-level chess play via supervised learning on a new 10M game benchmark dataset, demonstrating impressive generalization beyond memorization.

item.title: CAT3D: Create Anything in 3D with Multi-View Diffusion Models
item.description: CAT3D: Generate high-quality 3D scenes from as little as one image using a novel multi-view diffusion model, outperforming existing methods in speed and quality.

item.title: Decoupling Semantic Similarity from Spatial Alignment for Neural Networks.
item.description: Researchers developed semantic RSMs, a novel approach to measure semantic similarity in neural networks, improving image retrieval and aligning network representations with predicted class probabiliti…

item.title: EM Distillation for One-step Diffusion Models
item.description: EM Distillation (EMD) efficiently trains one-step diffusion models by using an Expectation-Maximization approach, achieving state-of-the-art image generation quality and outperforming existing methods…

item.title: FlexCap: Describe Anything in Images in Controllable Detail
item.description: FlexCap generates controllable, region-specific image descriptions of varying lengths, achieving state-of-the-art zero-shot visual question answering.

item.title: Foundations of Multivariate Distributional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: First oracle-free, computationally tractable algorithms for provably convergent multivariate distributional RL are introduced, achieving convergence rates matching scalar settings and offering insight…

item.title: Fractal Patterns May Illuminate the Success of Next-Token Prediction
item.description: LLMs’ success is explained by the self-similar, long-range dependent fractal structure of language; small-scale patterns reflect larger ones.

item.title: Generative Hierarchical Materials Search
item.description: Generative Hierarchical Materials Search (GenMS) uses AI to design novel crystal structures from natural language descriptions, outperforming prior methods in both fulfilling user requests and finding…

item.title: Improving Sparse Decomposition of Language Model Activations with Gated Sparse Autoencoders
item.description: Gated Sparse Autoencoders (GSAEs) achieve Pareto improvement over baseline SAEs for unsupervised feature discovery in language models, resolving the shrinkage bias of L1 penalty by separating feature …

item.title: Learning rigid-body simulators over implicit shapes for large-scale scenes and vision
item.description: SDF-Sim: A novel learned rigid-body simulator that leverages SDFs to achieve unprecedented scalability, enabling simulations with hundreds of objects and millions of nodes.

item.title: Learning Successor Features the Simple Way
item.description: Learn deep Successor Features (SFs) directly from pixels, efficiently and without representation collapse, using a novel, simple method combining TD and reward prediction loss!

item.title: LocCa: Visual Pretraining with Location-aware Captioners
item.description: LocCa, a novel visual pretraining paradigm, uses location-aware captioning tasks to boost downstream localization performance while maintaining holistic task capabilities.

item.title: Many-Shot In-Context Learning
item.description: Scaling up in-context learning using thousands of examples significantly boosts Large Language Model (LLM) performance, particularly for complex tasks. Novel training methods mitigate reliance on hum…

item.title: Mind the Graph When Balancing Data for Fairness or Robustness
item.description: Data balancing in machine learning can hurt fairness and robustness; this paper reveals when and why, offering solutions for safer AI.

item.title: Moving Off-the-Grid: Scene-Grounded Video Representations
item.description: MooG: Self-supervised video model learns off-the-grid representations, enabling consistent scene element tracking even with motion; outperforming grid-based baselines on various vision tasks.

item.title: Near-Minimax-Optimal Distributional Reinforcement Learning with a Generative Model
item.description: New distributional RL algorithm (DCFP) achieves near-minimax optimality for return distribution estimation in the generative model regime.

item.title: Neglected Hessian component explains mysteries in sharpness regularization
item.description: Deep learning’s mysteries surrounding sharpness regularization are solved by uncovering the crucial role of the neglected Hessian component, the Nonlinear Modeling Error (NME).

item.title: Neural Assets: 3D-Aware Multi-Object Scene Synthesis with Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Neural Assets enables intuitive 3D multi-object scene editing via image diffusion models by using per-object representations to control individual object poses, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Normalization and effective learning rates in reinforcement learning
item.description: Normalize-and-Project (NaP) boosts reinforcement learning by stabilizing layer normalization, preventing plasticity loss, and enabling effective learning rate control.

item.title: Privacy Backdoors: Enhancing Membership Inference through Poisoning Pre-trained Models
item.description: Researchers reveal ‘privacy backdoors,’ a new attack that exploits pre-trained models to leak user training data, highlighting critical vulnerabilities and prompting stricter model security measures.

item.title: Recurrent Complex-Weighted Autoencoders for Unsupervised Object Discovery
item.description: SynCx, a novel recurrent autoencoder with complex weights, surpasses state-of-the-art models in unsupervised object discovery by iteratively refining phase relationships to achieve robust object bindi…

item.title: Schrodinger Bridge Flow for Unpaired Data Translation
item.description: Accelerate unpaired data translation with Schr√∂dinger Bridge Flow, a novel algorithm solving optimal transport problems efficiently without repeatedly training models!

item.title: ShiftAddLLM: Accelerating Pretrained LLMs via Post-Training Multiplication-Less Reparameterization
item.description: ShiftAddLLM accelerates pretrained LLMs via post-training, multiplication-less reparameterization, achieving significant memory and energy reductions with comparable or better accuracy than existing m…

item.title: Simplified and Generalized Masked Diffusion for Discrete Data
item.description: Simplified and generalized masked diffusion models achieve state-of-the-art results in discrete data generation, surpassing previous methods in text and image modeling.

item.title: Stepping on the Edge: Curvature Aware Learning Rate Tuners
item.description: Adaptive learning rate tuners often underperform; Curvature Dynamics Aware Tuning (CDAT) prioritizes long-term curvature stabilization, outperforming tuned constant learning rates.

item.title: The Group Robustness is in the Details: Revisiting Finetuning under Spurious Correlations
item.description: Finetuning’s impact on worst-group accuracy is surprisingly nuanced, with common class-balancing methods sometimes hurting performance; a novel mixture method consistently outperforms others.

item.title: Time-Reversal Provides Unsupervised Feedback to LLMs
item.description: Time-reversed language models provide unsupervised feedback for improving LLMs, offering a cost-effective alternative to human feedback and enhancing LLM safety.

item.title: To Believe or Not to Believe Your LLM: IterativePrompting for Estimating Epistemic Uncertainty
item.description: This paper introduces an innovative iterative prompting method for estimating epistemic uncertainty in LLMs, enabling reliable detection of hallucinations.

item.title: Towards Estimating Bounds on the Effect of Policies under Unobserved Confounding
item.description: This paper presents a novel framework for estimating bounds on policy effects under unobserved confounding, offering tighter bounds and robust estimators for higher-dimensional data.

item.title: Understanding Transformers via N-Gram Statistics
item.description: LLMs’ inner workings remain elusive. This study uses N-gram statistics to approximate transformer predictions, revealing how LLMs learn from simple to complex statistical rules, and how model variance…

item.title: UQE: A Query Engine for Unstructured Databases
item.description: UQE: A novel query engine uses LLMs for efficient and accurate unstructured data analytics, surpassing existing methods.

item.title: Web-Scale Visual Entity Recognition: An LLM-Driven Data Approach
item.description: LLM-powered data curation boosts web-scale visual entity recognition!

item.title: What type of inference is planning?
item.description: Planning is redefined as a distinct inference type within a variational framework, enabling efficient approximate planning in complex environments.
